intro: Isotrema howii, commonly known as the Hawaiian fernbush, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the unique climate of Hawaii. Isotrema howii plays a role in the local ecosystem and is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptation.
